free_text.Learning outcomes: At the end of the course, the student has to master the problems related to the integration of civil engineering projects in the environment. The course is taught along with a multidisciplinary case study. The students have to acquire the methodologies that are useful to analyze, at the stage of the project design, the effects on the environment of civil engineering constructions and infrastructures. The case study of the new edition of the course will be related to the hydroelectric plant of Mauvoisin II.
free_text.Content: [li]Introduction[br/][li]The design and realization of civil engineering constructions and infrastructures: a complex problem[br/][li]Methods to deal with complex problems[br/][li]Impacts of large infrastructure projects[br/][li]Taking into account sustainable development requirements since the design stage, in relation with the following aspects: choice of the site location, construction materials, building techniques, concepts of elimination, supply and management of the flows[br/][li]Environmental norms and labels in the field of building and construction[br/][li]Life cycle assessment of civil engineering construction[br/][li]Basics of ecosystems[br/][li]Integration of constructions and infrastructures in the environment: problems and solutions[br/][li]Involvement of actors and partnership during the project[br/][li]Role of Non Governmental Organisations (NGOs)[br/][li]Case of hydraulic schemes[br/]-	Environmental impacts of hydraulic constructions[br/]-	Integrated approach[br/]-	Compensation measures[br/][li]Case study : Mauvoisin II - Increase of the power[br/]-	Presentation of the project[br/]-	Visit of the sites[br/]-	Work in groups on specific problems

free_text.Préparation pour: Études d'impact, Aménagement du territoire, Intégration à l'environnement
free_text.Objectifs d'apprentissage: A la fin du cours, l'étudiant doit être capable de comprendre les problèmes posés par l'intégration des projets de génie civil dans l'environnement. Le cours s'articule autour d'un projet de nature multidisciplinaire. Les étudiants doivent acquérir les méthodologies utiles pour l'analyse, au stade de la conception du projet, des effets sur l'environnement des ouvrages et infrastructures du génie civil. L'étude de cas de la présente édition concerne le projet de l'aménagement hydroélectrique de Mauvoisin II.
